transcript: All products featured on Vogue are independently selected by our editors. However, we may receive compensation from retailers and/or from purchases of products through these links. It is very rare that I find myself overthinking an outfit. While I do put ample thought into what I wear—checking the weather, getting dressed with important meetings and after-work commitments in mind, and asking myself how long I can really walk in a pair of platforms—I'm not one to spiral like Cher in Clueless looking for her white, collarless shirt from Fred Segal, or make a mess of my room, trying on everything I own while bemoaning that I have nothing to wear! There are two exceptions, though: If I'm going to a game and cheering for a team with red, white, and blue team colors, or, if it's the Fourth of July. A few months ago, while in Philadelphia for a 76ers vs. Golden State Warriors game, I opted for a blue crop top, a white faux fur coat, and a bold red lip. I wanted to look like I was supporting the Sixers, but I did not want to look like a walking American flag; I know I'm not alone in that trepidation. American history is marred by atrocities against Black people: Slavery, Jim Crow, lynching, centuries of systemic racism that has permeated everything from public education and the justice system to housing and healthcare. All of this has transpired, and much of it continues to, despite the fact that the United States as we know it would not exist without the contributions of Black people. I was born and raised here. I could not be more proud of my ancestors. I have lived a comfortable and privileged life in America. But given all the ways the country has mistreated and disenfranchised Black people, I've never been compelled to wear patriotism on my sleeve. That sentiment is especially strong today, as I find myself increasingly enraged by this country's current political and social landscape. This Fourth of July I will likely be in black; to me, it feels more like America's funeral than its birthday. My aversion to star-spangled fashion is such that in the rare instances when it actually resonates with me, I'm wholly taken aback. There is perhaps no better example of this than my reverence for Beyoncé's Cowboy Carter looks. When Beyoncé announced the release of Cowboy Carter in March of 2024, she did so with cover art that features the Houston native atop a white horse, holding an American flag, and wearing a custom red, white, and blue Busted Brand latex ensemble (fittingly inclusive of chaps), and white Paris Texas heeled boots. In an Instagram caption, she noted the criticism she faced while pursuing country music, and how she felt unwelcome in the genre's space—a space that wouldn't exist were it not for the contributions of Black artists. Sound familiar? As with nearly everything Beyoncé releases, the Cowboy Carter iconography became fodder for polarizing public discourse. In an opinion piece for The Guardian, Derecka Purnell wrote that the “pervasive idea that 'Black people built America' and are therefore entitled to its flag, pride, and positions of power can miss that much of what this country is and does is poisonous.” Janelle Hobson, who wrote about the visuals for Ms. and discussed them on NPR's Morning Edition podcast, ascertained that the imagery could have multiple meanings: Reclamation, yes, but also an acknowledgement of all the convictions and contradictions the American flag can stand for. Perhaps Beyoncé is “inviting us to wrest with the contentions between our different interpretations.” For Pop Sugar, my friend Jessican Andrews wrote that Beyoncé is “not embracing Americana fashion as propaganda or using it to seek white validation, [but] taking a nuanced approach. She's honoring her Black American cultural upbringing while acknowledging the ways American ideology has been exclusionary and problematic.” Beyoncé hasn't spoken publicly about her album cover art or the many red, white, and blue looks she's worn on the Cowboy Carter tour—and she and I aren't friends (yet)—so I can't say definitively why she has decided to lean so hard into the patriotic aesthetic. But as a fashion editor (and someone with exceptional vision) I can say that absolutely no one is wearing stars and stripes like she is. Painstakingly detailed, tailored to perfection, and rife with symbolism, the pieces that make up Beyoncé's current wardrobe will be remembered long after the tour concludes later this month. Since going on the road in April, Beyoncé has worn American flag Levi's chaps—the stars and stripes rendered in Swarovski crystals—and a shimmery USA-themed David Koma football jersey. Deftly styled by Shiona Turini, Bey donned a Coperni bodysuit with American flag bell bottoms to perform in L.A., and Burberry crystal-fringed American flag trousers in London. A red paisley bodysuit and draped overlay worn with distressed denim shorts came courtesy of Loewe, as did a checked-patterned shirt and skirt set in blue, paired with thigh-high white and red flame cowboy boots. Black designers have been integral to the Cowboy Carter story, with Beyoncé taking the stage in pieces by Telfar, Tongoro, Ib Kamara's Off-White, and Ferragamo by Maximilian Davis. Beyoncé's intentionality, Turini's talent, and a trove of custom pieces by renowned houses and emerging brands have made for an aspirational red, white, and blue wardrobe. That's no small feat for an aesthetic often embraced by groups with a narrow, exclusionary view of who can claim the American flag as their own. Fans show up to the Cowboy Carter tour in thoughtful, inventive takes on Western Americana fashion, stadiums filled with denim, bandanas, cowboy hats, and looks that don't just scream U.S.A but hoot and holler. When I went to the show in Houston, I carried a paisley-embossed NDG vanity bag (red), and wore a cropped HommeGirls tank (white) with denim 3x1 x Air Force 1 Nikes (blue). In the days since the concert, a number of friends, family, and colleagues have asked me about it—mostly inquiring about the set list and the car prop malfunction. What I inevitably discuss first, though, are the clothes. They're mesmerizing in their detail and design, but also worn with a sense of confidence and joy that, while understandably hard for many to relate to, echoes an optimism that will eventually overcome today's atrocities. I believe that this both sartorial and emotional spirit lives up to some semblance of what the American flag should represent. Well, one can only hope.

transcript: One of the biggest developments in addressable media over this year has been the rollout of AI driven targeting solutions and at dentsu  our focus this year has been to come aboard the algorithmic era exploring solutions in market from our key partners like Teads  Smart Targeting and Amazon  Perfomance+. as well as dentsu's own AI solutions. A dentsu (industry) client has even seen one of these AI solutions account for the largest share of conversions as a result of AI boosting the decisions traders have already made. Why do these solutions perform so well? Their ability to iterate... As marketers we can fairly easily create a targeting strategy for a particular brand, Burberry shoppers are very likely going to be high earners who read Tatler etc. And maybe we can think laterally to an extent as well, throw in those with an affinity for luxury cars or investment for example. But the Deep Learning models which underpin these solutions allow us to target IDs which we would not even consider and then rapidly learn and iterate based on signals, while remaining conscious of KPIs. This allows for an extremely efficient and effective method for hitting targets, and I foresee a time when the vast majority of campaigns will have an AI component as part of the initial targeting strategy. The iterative nature of the solutions means these models can provide data and insights about potential demographics for products which brands may not have even thought to consider. Will this information ever be available for brands to access? One day, for a steep price I imagine. This is the most use of data, the ability to find out what we don't know... Feel free to share your thoughts in the comments. #AI ##programmatic #digitalmarketing #tech
cleaned_transcript: One of the biggest developments in addressable media over this year has been the rollout of AI driven targeting solutions and at dentsu our focus this year has been to come aboard the algorithmic era exploring solutions in market from our key partners like Teads Smart Targeting and Amazon Perfomance+. as well as dentsu's own AI solutions. A dentsu (industry) client has even seen one of these AI solutions account for the largest share of conversions as a result of AI boosting the decisions traders have already made. Why do these solutions perform so well? Their ability to iterate... As marketers we can fairly easily create a targeting strategy for a particular brand, Burberry shoppers are very likely going to be high earners who read Tatler etc. And maybe we can think laterally to an extent as well, throw in those with an affinity for luxury cars or investment for example. But the Deep Learning models which underpin these solutions allow us to target IDs which we would not even consider and then rapidly learn and iterate based on signals, while remaining conscious of KPIs. This allows for an extremely efficient and effective method for hitting targets, and I foresee a time when the vast majority of campaigns will have an AI component as part of the initial targeting strategy. The iterative nature of the solutions means these models can provide data and insights about potential demographics for products which brands may not have even thought to consider. Will this information ever be available for brands to access? One day, for a steep price I imagine. This is the most use of data, the ability to find out what we don't know... Feel free to share your thoughts in the comments. #
reasoning: While the post mentions Burberry as an example in a broader discussion about AI-driven marketing targeting, the content is not specifically about Burberry fragrances or products. The brand is used generically to illustrate a point about marketing strategies, with no meaningful connection to Burberry's brand, products, or fragrances.

transcript: SPR_COMBO[es]Un deslumbrante momento de glamour en el estreno de "Heads of State" Es el oro líquido de Marruecos: celebrities y dermatólogos lo aman Paula Echevarría, sobre el posado con su hija Daniella en una alfombra roja: "Me arrepentí un poco" La noche del 1 de julio de 2025 brilló con la presencia de Priyanka Chopra Jonas y Nick Jonas en la proyección londinense de Heads of State, un evento que capturó la esencia del estilo y el romance de la pareja. Con 42 años, Priyanka deslumbró con un vestido de Burberry que definió la elegancia contemporánea, fusionando moda y significado en cada detalle. Nick Jonas, de 32 años, complementó el look de su esposa con un traje azul marino y zapatillas Burberry Rogue, creando una imagen de sofisticación conjunta que cautivó todas las miradas. Un momento cinematográfico inolvidable La película "Heads of State", dirigida por Ilya Naishuller, presenta a Priyanka como Noel Bisset, una agente del MI6, compartiendo pantalla con estrellas como John Cena e Idris Elba. La trama, una comedia de acción, promete mantener al público en vilo desde su estreno en Prime Video, según apuntan desde People. La elección de Chopra por papeles que desafían estereotipos reafirma su posición como una actriz versátil en la industria cinematográfica internacional. Su interpretación refleja no solo talento, sino también un compromiso con narrativas contemporáneas. La aparición de la pareja trasciende lo visual, representando un momento de celebración que entrelaza amor, profesionalismo y glamour. Su presencia en la alfombra roja no solo atrae miradas, sino que también amplifica conversaciones sobre diversidad y representación en el mundo del entretenimiento. En cada paso, cada pose, Priyanka y Nick demuestran que su conexión va más allá de lo romántico: es una alianza de dos carreras exitosas que se potencian mutuamente, inspirando a una generación que valora tanto el amor como la realización profesional. La noche londinense se convirtió en un testimonio viviente de cómo dos celebridades pueden crear momentos mágicos que resuenan más allá de la alfombra roja, conectando con su audiencia a través de su autenticidad y pasión compartida. Heads of State no es solo una película, es un nuevo capítulo en la brillante trayectoria de Priyanka Chopra Jonas, un proyecto que promete sorprender y entretener, reflejando su continua evolución como artista global. La química entre Priyanka y Nick, su apoyo mutuo y su capacidad para brillar individual y conjuntamente, confirman que son mucho más que una pareja de figuras públicas: son un equipo que redefine el éxito en múltiples dimensiones.

La química entre Priyanka y Nick, su apoyo mutuo y su capacidad para brillar individual y conjuntamente, confirman que son mucho más que una pareja de figuras públicas: son un equipo que redefine el éxito en múltiples dimensiones.
reasoning: The comment mentions Priyanka Chopra wearing a Burberry dress at a movie premiere, highlighting the brand's fashion and style in a meaningful context. Nick Jonas also wore Burberry Rogue shoes, providing a direct and intentional reference to the brand's fashion and red carpet presence.

transcript: Have YOU got a story? Email tips@dailymail.com Poppy Delevingne has welcomed her first child with her partner Archie Keswick. The model, 39, and the billionaire businessman, 44, who went public with their relationship last June, shared their happy news to Instagram on Friday. Uploading a black and white snap clutching her baby girl's hand, Poppy penned: '20.05.25 The stars aligned, & then there was you.' Revealing her daughter's name, she continued: 'KAIA MOON KESWICK. Welcome to the world, baby bear. You have our hearts, our everything.' Poppy announced in January that she was expecting her first child, a baby girl, with her partner, Archie. The socialite said becoming a mother is 'all I've ever wanted,' as she shared the happy news with Elle magazine. Poppy first discovered she was pregnant during London Fashion Week when, during a fitting for a Burberry show, she noticed her clothes were tighter than usual. Sensing something was different, Poppy took a pregnancy test shortly after and then learned she was expecting a daughter. Speaking to ELLE UK in January, she said: 'Obviously, I would have been fine with either, and when I was younger, I always thought when I get pregnant, I wouldn't find out, but the second we got told we could find out, we did. I'm so excited. I come from all girls, we're very girl-heavy. Girls are great.' Poppy's sisters, model Cara, 32, and socialite Chloe, 39, were both delighted when she told them the news. She said: 'We were all in New York, with each other and with the bump, and there was a lot of talking to the bump, stroking the bump. They're just elated.' Poppy and Archie kept the news of her pregnancy to themselves for a while and only told friends and family around the four-month mark. The model previously admitted she was 'really nervous' about her pregnancy and wanted to 'protect' it for a while. She explained: 'It just feels like such an extraordinary privilege to be able to do this, to be able to have a baby at this age and at this time, and when it happened, I couldn't really believe it.' Poppy has long wanted to start a family of her own, but admitted in recent years she thought it might not happen for her and had 'made peace with it'. Poppy and Archie went public with their romance in July 2024, when they attended the BST Hyde Park festival together. Archie is the son of Simon Keswick, former director of multi-billion pound Hong Kong conglomerate Jardine Matheson - owner of the Mandarin Oriental Hotel Group. The family has a private fortune of £6.35bn, according to the Sunday Times Rich List, and owns an 18,000-acre estate in Angus. Now the group's interests range from prime Hong Kong real estate and brands, including the Mandarin Oriental Hotel, to Vietnam's largest dairy producer. Archie was previously described as a 'demon on the tennis court' who 'loves house music' by Tatler. The Eton-educated businessman was named as one of the world's most eligible bachelors back in 2019. Archie is no stranger to a high-profile relationship. He previously dated actress Sienna Miller, 43, who once lived with Poppy during their New York days. He was linked to Sienna after reportedly being friends for years. The actress is now in a relationship with model Oli Green, 28, and they welcomed a daughter in December 2023. Poppy was previously married to James Cook. While neither addressed the break-up publicly, they are said to have called time on their union after eight years in 2022. Before finding love with Archie, Poppy was linked to Prince Constantine Alexios of Greece, 26, in April 2023.

transcript: Delay it as he has and request otherwise as he might, Cameron Norrie's time to take centre stage at Wimbledon has arrived. There was little attention on the 29-year-old heading into these Championships, the focus instead largely on Jack Draper and the assumption that he would lead the home charge over this fortnight. But Draper has succumbed to a early exit, as he did a year ago when losing to Norrie, and the thirst for British success must be quenched elsewhere. There will be no Burberry influencers in tow, the montages not quite as well-prepared, but Norrie finds himself in possession of the baton. He has made it clear he has little desire to grace Centre Court, preferring the setting and atmosphere of Court No1, and he looked at home once again in first battling and then cruising to a 7-6 6-4 6-2 win over Mattia Bellucci. There is only so long, however, that wishes can be granted. Norrie, a semi-finalist in 2022, is once again the last British man remaining in the singles draw and the spotlight cannot be avoided much longer. Nor, in all likelihood, the grandeur of Wimbledon's most hallowed ground, with a fourth-round clash to come against Joao Fonseca or Nicolas Jarry and beyond that, a potential quarter-final showdown with Carlos Alcaraz. “Every single big moment you got loud and changed the momentum, it was a big factor in the match,” Norrie said in his on-court interview afterwards. “I've got to thank you guys for that. “When I saw the schedule I was really happy. Hopefully I can play my next match on here, I don't know. Hopefully I can play all my matches on here.” Norrie's presence in the draw deep into the second week relies on that not being the case, but the sentiment is understandable. 12th seed Frances Tiafoe, beaten by Norrie in the second round, believed the support lifted the Briton to heights he would not otherwise have reached. It was Bellucci making the early noise here, though, with close to half of the Court No1 crowd still yet to return to their seats as the Italian made a flying start. He won the first seven points on Norrie's serve, which had been so much of a weapon against Tiafoe. Norrie's game is one not built on power or flair but rather grit and dogged determination. He just about avoided falling a double-break behind, scrambling out of trouble, before breaking to love in the following game to level it up at 4-4. They remained locked all the way through to 5-5 in the tie-break, when Norrie produced the match's best point at the biggest moment. The 24th and final shot of a bruising rally was a stunning backhand pass down the line, bringing up a set point that was duly converted. Bellucci was offering up an entertaining spectacle on his own, not shy in throwing everything at a huge forehand while also fighting a regular balance battle as he slid around, at times chaotically, behind the baseline. One awkward lunge early in the second set left him bent over, hand on knee, but Bellucci's mood was swiftly improved as a backhand winner recovered the break he had given up in the opening game. Norrie restored his advantage in familiar fashion, first hanging in and then taking charge of a another long rally to break for 4-3. The Briton has spoken of wanting an engaged crowd and he got just that, the good and the bad, as he served for the set. First the rallying cries when he fell 15-30 down, the murmurs of disappointment when a first serve crashed into the net, and the groans as a forehand flew long on set point. And then, minutes later, an almighty roar as an ace out wide sealed a two-set lead. Bellucci was at his most vulnerable when in control of a point, Norrie reading a smash and hammering a backhand winner down the line to secure a break early in the third. A break of serve and, seemingly, spirit. The Italian swiftly surrendered his serve again, this time to love, and that provided Norrie with ample breathing room. He was broken when serving for the match at 5-2, but completed the job in the following game. Now a nervous wait for Sunday's order of play.

transcript: NEED TO KNOW Model Poppy Delevingne has welcomed a baby girl with partner Archie Keswick Delevingne announced the news on Instagram on July 4 Poppy Delevingne first shared her pregnancy news in January Poppy Delevingne is a mom! The model, 39, and Archie Keswick have welcomed a baby girl, Delevingne announced in an Instagram post on Friday, July 4. "20.05.25. The stars aligned, & then there was you. KAIA MOON KESWICK  Welcome to the world, baby bear. You have our hearts, our everything," the message reads. The caption was accompanied by a photo of the infant's hand wrapped around Delevingne's thumb. Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer​​, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories. Delevingne — who is the middle sister of Chloe, 39, and Cara, 32 — first shared her pregnancy news in January, in an interview with Elle UK. There, the model mom revealed that after feeling that her clothes felt tighter during a fitting for Burberry's London Fashion Week show in the fall, she took a pregnancy test and learned the exciting news. "She really is all I've ever wanted," Delevingne said, sharing her excitement to welcome a daughter. “Obviously, I would have been fine with either and when I was younger I always thought when I get pregnant, I wouldn't find out, but the second we got told we could find out, we did,” she continued. “I'm so excited. I come from all girls, we're very girl heavy. Girls are great.” The couple waited until around the four-month mark to reveal to friends and family that they were expecting a baby together. She said her sisters were “elated” by the news, with all of the “important women” in her life willing to support her through the pregnancy. David M. Benett/Getty Poppy Delevingne, Cara Delevingne and Chloe Delevingne attend the Mulberry dinner to celebrate the launch of the Cara Delevingne Collection at Claridge's Hotel on February 16, 2014 Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer​​, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories. “It just feels like such an extraordinary privilege to be able to do this, to be able to have a baby at this age and at this time, and when it happened, I couldn't really believe it. It still feels really surreal,” Delevingne told Elle UK. Her billionaire businessman partner whom she said was “born to be a dad” has two children from a previous marriage and was previously linked to actress Sienna Miller. More in Celebrity The model shared sweet photos from her baby shower in late April, where sisters Chloe, 39, and Cara, 32, were there to celebrate the newest member of the family. "Well & truly showered…  And not just one, but two beautiful surprises… Lucky me & peanut to have you all,        ," she captioned the photos from the day. Delevingne was previously married to James Cook but separated in 2022 after eight years of marriage.

transcript: He said in a statement: "I believe Gucci is a brand that transcends the past and present through heritage and contemporary creativity. It's a great honor to be part of Gucci's visionary journey." The announcement comes just a few weeks after it was revealed fellow Stray Kids member Seungmin had been appointed a brand ambassador for Burberry, who were delighted to have the K-pop star on board. Chief creative officer Daniel Lee said in a statement: "His passion and sense of style will make working together a lot of fun." Seungmin - who was chosen for his authenticity, self-expression and innovative nature - hailed the partnership "an honour". He said: "It is an honour to join the Burberry family. "It's an iconic British brand with a rich heritage, and I love that connection. I'm excited to be part of its future." Seungmin's appointment was revealed shortly after the 24-year-old star was part of Burberry's Festival campaign alongside the likes of Goldie, Loyle Carner, Cara Delevingne, Alexa Chung, and Liam Gallagher and his model children Lennon and Gene Gallagher and Molly Moorish-Gallagher. Lee Know's bandmate HAN recently praised him as being a "very handsome" man and expressed his gratitude that his friend is always happy to look out for him. HAN told Rolling Stone of Lee Know: "He is very handsome. And even though he may not look like it, he's very sensitive and meticulous. And he listens to me and only me. "I can get lonely being away from home, and he takes very good care of me. After a concert, we spend quality time together. We all do, actually, and we share delicious food together."

transcript: Their triumph at the 2022 Euros turned England's Lionesses from little-known footballers into national heroines. And if the tournament made them famous, it also transformed their lives off the pitch. From lucrative brand ambassadorships with high-end fashion labels such as Gucci to turns on the red carpet in dresses worthy of a Kardashian, England's female footballers now enjoy more than a touch of glitz and glamour. Once badly paid and barely recognised – who could forget goalie Mary Earps complaining before the last Euros that Nike hadn't even bothered to print replica shirts with her name on them – the nation's female footballers now have a soaring commercial appeal. So as they prepare to face France at 8pm tonight in their first game of this year's Euros – and inspire a new generation of young women with their sporting prowess – Molly Clayton reveals which of our Lionesses enjoys the most luxurious lifestyle. The Gucci model Shoots for Vogue, GQ and Elle Magazine. Modelling for Calvin Klein. Gucci snapping her up as a brand ambassador. Clearly, as well as being an impressive England captain, Leah Williamson, 28, has a catwalk-worthy fashion career too. One of the biggest earners off the pitch after leading the Lionesses to victory at the Euro 2022 final, the blonde beauty has a deal with Nike and has collaborated with global brands such as Aston Martin, Pepsi, Walkers and Mastercard. With 1.1 million Instagram followers, she has new advert partnerships with Weetabix and Cadbury, along with six children's books, titled The Wonder Team. With the deals comes the gloss: her recent lavish Mallorcan holiday to an Ikos resort would have set her back in the region of £1,000 a night. She is rumoured to be dating former model and Miss USA Elle Smith – both have posted about each other on social media. Ella the business brainbox With her ever-present fake eyelashes and love of make-up, Manchester United midfielder Ella Toone, 25, often showcases her beauty routine on her own YouTube channel. And with a canny business acumen to boot, Ella has already shaped an enviable off-pitch career. The first England women's player to trademark her name, she's set up her own brand, ET7, which includes a football academy for young girls. The name is inspired by her childhood hero, Portuguese footballing superstar Cristiano Ronaldo, whose own brand is called CR7. With some estimating her worth at more than £1 million, last month she set up her own creative agency, Amicizia, which aims to connect female athletes to commercial and marketing opportunities with top brands. Her sponsors include make-up company Charlotte Tilbury, orthodontic brand Invisalign and McDonald's, with her yearly earnings estimated as upwards of £200,000, fuelled by her popularity on social media. At one point, she was one of the top five most viewed athletes on TikTok. Ella has 737,000 Instagram followers and her own BBC podcast with best friend and fellow Lioness Alessia Russo, with whom she has appeared on the front cover of fashion and beauty magazine Elle. Ella loves nothing more than a red carpet bash. In a relationship with footballer Joe Bunney of Stalybridge Celtic FC, she regularly treats her fans to glimpses of their lavish holidays abroad and spa days at five-star hotels. Lauren's ooh la la lego Proving that every passion can be profitable, Manchester City forward Lauren Hemp, 24, has topped up her estimated £400,000 salary with a sponsorship deal with Lego. Devoted to creating Lego masterpieces in her downtime, saying it's 'the best way to relax', she's even made the Mona Lisa out of the bricks. Her other sponsors include Nike and Sports Direct. Lauren also has the support of her girlfriend, former Liverpool midfielder Ashley Hodson. Together for two years, the pair recently enjoyed a romantic trip to Paris, where Lauren saw the Mona Lisa in her more traditional setting. Shy superstar with an ex on the team Growing up, Lucy Bronze lived on Lindisfarne – also known as Holy Island – off the windswept coast of Northumberland. Her grandmother was caretaker of Lindisfarne Castle and today the outline of that building is tattooed on Lucy's wrist. Shy into adulthood, she was diagnosed with ADHD and autism in 2021. But neither her isolated upbringing nor her neurodiversity held her back. Rather, she's said she uses the intense focus associated with her conditions to her advantage – and now the 33-year-old is one of the biggest earners in the game. She reportedly took home £200,000 a year while playing at Barcelona before her move to Chelsea in 2024. Big money deals followed her triumph at the last Euros, with Pepsi, EE, Klarna and Visa among her backers. Her former girlfriend is fellow Lioness Keira Walsh. Fashion week regular She earned almost £2 million in 2023 alone, according to Forbes magazine. That same year, Alessia Russo's transfer from Manchester United to Arsenal made her one of the most expensive female footballers on the planet. Her contract is said to be worth more than £500,000 a year and her commercial appeal is just as lucrative. She has deals with Gucci, Adidas, PlayStation, Beats by Dr Dre and last month was gifted an MGS5 EV car, which she proudly showed off on Instagram. A regular at London Fashion Week, Alessia, 26, has appeared on the cover of magazines such as Women's Health. The BAFTA TV Awards in May saw her in a £1,295 Roland Mouret dress, right. Revealing outfits... on pitch too! Hair scraped back and with braces on her teeth, Chloe Kelly scored that late winning goal against Germany at Wembley in 2022, famously taking off her top in celebration. Since then, she has revelled in her success with a glossy makeover....

transcript: THE GUCCI MODEL SHOOTS for Vogue, GQ and Elle Magazine. Modelling for Calvin Klein. Gucci snapping her up as a brand ambassador. Clearly, as well as being an impressive England captain, Leah Williamson, 28, has a catwalk-worthy fashion career too. One of the biggest earners off the pitch after leading the Lionesses to victory at the Euro 2022 final, the blonde beauty has a deal with Nike and has collaborated with global brands such as Aston Martin, Pepsi, Walkers and Mastercard. With 1.1 million Instagram followers, she has new advert partnerships with Weetabix and Cadbury, along with six children's books, titled The Wonder Team. With the deals comes the gloss: her recent lavish Mallorcan holiday to an Ikos resort would have set her back in the region of £1,000 a night. She is rumoured to be dating former model and Miss USA Elle Smith - both have posted about each other on social media. LAUREN'S OOH LA LA LEGO PROVING that every passion can be profitable, Manchester City forward Lauren Hemp, 24, has topped up her estimated £400,000 salary with a sponsorship deal with Lego. Devoted to creating Lego masterpieces in her downtime, saying it's 'the best way to relax', she's even made the Mona Lisa out of the bricks. Her other sponsors include Nike and Sports Direct. Lauren also has the support of her girlfriend, former Liverpool midfielder Ashley Hodson. Together for two years, the pair recently enjoyed a romantic trip to Paris, where Lauren saw the Mona Lisa in her more traditional setting. SHY SUPERSTAR WITH AN EX ON THE TEAM GROWING up, Lucy Bronze lived on Lindisfarne - also known as Holy Island - off the windswept coast of Northumberland. Her grandmother was caretaker of Lindisfarne Castle and today the outline of that building is tattooed on Lucy's wrist. Shy into adulthood, she was diagnosed with ADHD and autism in 2021. But neither her isolated upbringing nor her neurodiversity held her back. Rather, she's said she uses the intense focus associated with her conditions to her advantage - and now the 33-year-old is one of the biggest earners in the game. She reportedly took home £200,000 a year while playing at Barcelona before her move to Chelsea in 2024. Big money deals followed her triumph at the last Euros, with Pepsi, EE, Klarna and Visa among her backers. Her former girlfriend is fellow Lioness Keira Walsh. FASHION WEEK REGULAR SHE earned almost £2million in 2023 alone, according to Forbes magazine. That same year, Alessia Russo's transfer from Manchester United to Arsenal made her one of the most expensive female footballers on the planet. Her contract is said to be worth more than £500,000 a year and her commercial appeal is just as lucrative. She has deals with Gucci, Adidas, PlayStation, Beats by Dr Dre and last month was gifted an MGS5 EV car, which she proudly showed off on Instagram. A regular at London Fashion Week, Alessia, 26, has appeared on the cover of magazines such as Women's Health. The BAFTA TV Awards in May saw her in a £1,295 Roland Mouret dress, right. BURBERRY CLAD GOALIE BURBERRY HANNAH Hampton - the longhaired goalkeeper with the girl-next-door looks - certainly has big shoes to fill after Mary Earps surprisingly announced her retirement from the squad last month. The 24-year-old Chelsea player has posed in Burberry for Elle magazine and counts Nike and Extra chewing gum among her corporate sponsors. She also works with Birmingham Children's Hospital after enduring numerous eye operations as a child to cure a squint. Hannah was told she would never be a professional sports player. ' I've gone through life proving people wrong,' she said recently, words that inspired devotion among her 228,000 Instagram followers. Her relationship status isn't known. DUBAI DEVOTEE SHE never travels without her Louis Vuitton luggage, can often be seen posing in a Maybach car, and enjoys swanky trips to Dubai, staying at the luxury Five resort there. Chelsea star Lauren James, 23, has treated herself to some of the finer things in life since her key role in the Lionesses' 2023 World Cup campaign. While her relationship status isn't known, she's close to her older brother Reece, who plays for the Chelsea men's team. She has commercial deals with Nike, Google Pixel, Optimum Nutrition, Sure deodorant and Walkers. The superstar siblings often attend red carpet events together. But while she is reportedly on £350,000 a year at Chelsea, Reece earns £250,000 a week. KOOKY STYLE SO DEVOTED is she to tattoos that midfielder Georgia Stanway, 26, not only has around 100 of her own inkings, but she's also learned to tattoo other people. The Bayern Munich star's kooky style has won her sponsors including Nike and an advertising deal with Celsius drinks, who featured on her Instagram page, where she has 433,000 followers. Off the pitch, she's been with Toulouse rugby league player Olly Ashall-Bott since 2022....

transcript: SPR_COMBO[id]Liputan6.com, Jakarta - Ketika Oasis memulai tur reuni yang telah lama ditunggu-tunggu pada Jumat, 4 Juli 2025, dengan menggelar konser pembuka di Cardiff, Wales, merek-merek fesyen diperkirakan akan merapat memberi "dukungan." Hubungan yang secara historis retak antara Liam dan Noel Gallagher tidak hanya akan menghasilkan pertunjukan gemilang, namun emosional. Maka itu, menjangkau khalayak luas dan memanfaatkan gelombang nostalgia Britpop tahun 90-an untuk penjualan yang lebih tinggi seharusnya dilakukan para brand fesyen, menurut kolumnis Andrea Felsted, dikutip dari Bloomberg, Sabtu, 5 Juli 2025. Acara musik, terutama tur, selain perilisan album terkenal, seperti Cowboy Carter milik Beyonce dan Brat milik Charli XCX tahun lalu, telah jadi fenomena budaya. Levi Strauss & Co bekerja sama dengan Beyonce setelah lagunya "Levii's Jeans," mengubah nama Instagram-nya sebentar menjadi "Levii's" dan meminta bintang tersebut untuk kampanye iklan. Banyak brand fesyen, termasuk Kate Spade milik Coach Inc., merangkul Brat. Sementara itu, desainer, termasuk Roberto Cavalli, Versace, dan Tiffany & Co. milik LVMH Moet Hennessy Louis Vuitton SE mendandani Taylor Swift. Kini, para pengecer berbondong-bondong mengikuti apa yang disebut sebagai "Wonderwall Summer."  Merek mewah asal Inggris Burberry Group Plc jadi yang terdepan. Meski tidak secara eksplisit terkait dengan tur tersebut, kampanye Burberry Festival menampilkan Liam Gallagher dan kedua putranya, Lennon dan Gene Gallagher, serta putrinya Molly Moorish-Gallagher. Dorongan pemasaran ini mengingatkan publik pada masa kejayaan Burberry di tahun 1990-an. Kampanye terbaru memang menampilkan musisi Goldie, serta para pesohor perempuan: Cara Delevingne dan Alexa Chung, tapi Liam adalah bintang utamanya. Ia mengenakan parka Burberry miliknya sendiri dari tahun 2018, yang akan diterbitkan ulang dalam edisi terbatas. Adidas AG lebih terbuka dalam menarik penggemar Oasis, dengan memproduksi koleksi dari co-branded clothing, yang dijual secara daring dan di toko-toko Adidas, serta Oasisinet.com, situs resminya, dan di stadion selama tur. Di antara nama-nama lain yang terlibat adalah Levi's, yang membuat serangkaian kaus oblong, dan Stone Island milik Moncler SpA, yang menampilkan Liam dalam kampanye musim gugurnya. Band rock pria, kata Felsted, berarti audiensnya beragam, yang berguna untuk penjualan pakaian pria dan wanita. Menurut GlobalData, pasar pakaian dan alas kaki pria sekitar dua pertiga dari ukuran pakaian wanita, menjadikannya peluang yang signifikan. Meski ketertarikan yang terus berlanjut terhadap segala hal yang berbau tahun 90-an telah memperkenalkan Oasis pada generasi baru, hampir setengah dari mereka yang hadir telah menyaksikan konser band tersebut sebelumnya, menurut laporan Belanja Konsumen Barclays Plc. Mengingat bahwa Gallagher bersaudara belum pernah tampil bersama sejak 2009, hal itu menyiratkan demografi yang lebih tua, yang sering kali berarti kelompok yang memiliki uang untuk dibelanjakan pada kegiatan rekreasi.  Ini juga membantu bahwa banyak gaya yang dikenakan band tersebut. Di antaranya adalah elana jins longgar, kaus sepak bola, dan sepatu kets low-rise yang kembali jadi tren berkat apa yang disebut estetika "Blokecore." Sementara Swifties mungkin telah memilih payet dan Beyhive dengan topi koboi, penggemar Oasis tampaknya berfoya-foya dengan parka dan topi bucket.  Meski panasnya musim panas, rata-rata unggahan  TikTok mingguan yang menampilkan parka naik 188 persen antara 1 Juni dan 1 Juli, dibandingkan dengan bulan sebelumnya, menurut perusahaan intelijen pasar Trendalytics. Pencarian parka di pasar barang bekas Depop naik 1.850 persen pada Juni 2025, dibandingkan dengan periode tahun sebelumnya. Topi bucket juga punya daya tarik tersendiri. Menurut penelitian Barclays, hampir sepertiga penggemar yang menghadiri konser berencana mengenakan busana bergaya tahun 90-an, dan untuk mendorong perusahaan yang bekerja sama, lebih dari seperlima berencana mengenakan co-branded item. Pembelian tersebut akan menyumbang 1,06 miliar pound sterling (sekitar Rp23,4 trilioun) yang diharapkan akan dibelanjakan penggemar Oasis Inggris secara keseluruhan, menurut Barclays. Angka ini mencakup tiket, akomodasi, serta biaya makanan dan minuman. Oasis sendiri tidak selalu memiliki hubungan yang mudah dengan dunia mode. Liam memulai Pretty Green pada 2009, tapi lini tersebut diakuisisi JD Sports Fashion Plc tahun 2019. Tiga tahun kemudian, JD menjualnya pada pesaingnya Frasers Group Plc. Namun, peritel yang dikendalikan Mike Ashley tersebut tidak lagi memiliki label tersebut.

Di antara nama-nama lain yang terlibat adalah Levi's, yang membuat serangkaian kaus oblong, dan Stone Island milik Moncler SpA, yang menampilkan Liam dalam kampanye musim gugurnya. Band rock pria, kata Felsted, berarti audiensnya beragam, yang berguna untuk penjualan pakaian pria dan wanita. Menurut GlobalData, pasar pakaian dan alas kaki pria sekitar dua pertiga dari ukuran pakaian wanita, menjadikannya peluang yang signifikan. Meski ketertarikan yang terus berlanjut terhadap segala hal yang berbau tahun 90-an telah memperkenalkan Oasis pada generasi baru, hampir setengah dari mereka yang hadir telah menyaksikan konser band tersebut sebelumnya, menurut laporan Belanja Konsumen Barclays Plc. Mengingat bahwa Gallagher bersaudara belum pernah tampil bersama sejak 2009, hal itu menyiratkan demografi yang lebih tua, yang sering kali berarti kelompok yang memiliki uang untuk dibelanjakan pada kegiatan rekreasi. Ini juga membantu bahwa banyak gaya yang dikenakan band tersebut. Di antaranya adalah elana jins longgar, kaus sepak bola, dan sepatu kets low-rise yang kembali jadi tren berkat apa yang disebut estetika "Blokecore." Sementara Swifties mungkin telah memilih payet dan Beyhive dengan topi koboi, penggemar Oasis tampaknya berfoya-foya dengan parka dan topi bucket. Meski panasnya musim panas, rata-rata unggahan TikTok mingguan yang menampilkan parka naik 188 persen antara 1 Juni dan 1 Juli, dibandingkan dengan bulan sebelumnya, menurut perusahaan intelijen pasar Trendalytics. Pencarian parka di pasar barang bekas Depop naik 1.850 persen pada Juni 2025, dibandingkan dengan periode tahun sebelumnya. Topi bucket juga punya daya tarik tersendiri. Menurut penelitian Barclays, hampir sepertiga penggemar yang menghadiri konser berencana mengenakan busana bergaya tahun 90-an, dan untuk mendorong perusahaan yang bekerja sama, lebih dari seperlima berencana mengenakan co-branded item. Pembelian tersebut akan menyumbang 1,06 miliar pound sterling (sekitar Rp23,4 trilioun) yang diharapkan akan dibelanjakan penggemar Oasis Inggris secara keseluruhan, menurut Barclays. Angka ini mencakup tiket, akomodasi, serta biaya makanan dan minuman. Oasis sendiri tidak selalu memiliki hubungan yang mudah dengan dunia mode. Liam memulai Pretty Green pada 2009, tapi lini tersebut diakuisisi JD Sports Fashion Plc tahun 2019. Tiga tahun kemudian, JD menjualnya pada pesaingnya Frasers Group Plc. Namun, peritel yang dikendalikan Mike Ashley tersebut tidak lagi memiliki label tersebut.
reasoning: The content mentions Burberry's marketing campaign featuring Liam Gallagher and his family, highlighting the brand's strategic connection to 1990s British music and fashion nostalgia. While the article is primarily about the Oasis band reunion, Burberry is specifically discussed in the context of its brand marketing and cultural positioning as a British luxury fashion brand.

transcript: Major luxury brands are rolling out sophisticated AI systems that recognize VIP customers the moment they step into stores. Prada is testing facial recognition technology that identifies high-value clients upon entry, automatically customizing their entire shopping experience before they even speak to a sales associate. Here's how the new luxury AI revolution works: Instant VIP Recognition: AI cameras identify top-tier customers as they enter, pulling up their purchase history, style preferences, and personal details Hyper-Personalized Service: Sales staff receive real-time alerts about the customer's favorite brands, sizes, and previous purchases AI Shopping Assistants: Dior and Louis Vuitton are developing virtual assistants that adapt to customers' evolving style preferences in real-time Smart Mirrors: Burberry has integrated intelligent mirrors that show how garments fit without customers physically trying them on One thing is certain: luxury shopping will never be the same. transcript: Impending Tax Hikes? Don't Slash Your Marketing – Optimise It! (And Potentially Save Big) The whisper of economic uncertainty is growing louder. With gloomy news headlines, rising government debt, and speculation that the Labour Chancellor, Rachel Reeves, will be increasing taxes to recoup the overspend and government borrowing, many businesses are already scrutinising every line of their expenditure. The natural instinct in times of belt-tightening is often to wield the axe, and regrettably, marketing budgets are frequently the first to face the chop. But here's a crucial warning: reducing your brand's marketing exposure should not be one of the cuts you make. In fact, it could be the most counterproductive move. Why Your Brand's Awareness is Non-Negotiable When economic headwinds blow, protecting your brand and its awareness amongst your current and potential audience becomes more, not less, vital. Diminishing your visibility risks: • Losing Market Share: Competitors who maintain or even increase their presence will steal your audience. • Eroding Brand Equity: Long-term brand building takes consistent effort. A sudden absence can quickly lead to forgetfulness. • Impacting Future Growth: Even if sales slow now, you need to be top-of-mind when the market picks up. Cutting marketing is a false economy that can inflict long-term damage far greater than any short-term savings. The key isn't to cut, but to optimise. Introducing Interlace: Your Smart Solution to Economic Headwinds This is precisely where Interlace comes in. We understand the pressure you're under to find efficiencies, but we believe you can do it without sacrificing your essential brand presence. What you currently do: From your digital footprint to your traditional outreach. 2. How you can retain it: Identifying strengths to leverage. 3. How you can possibly change it: Spotting areas for improvement, greater efficiency, and better ROI. We pride ourselves on being: • Experts in our field: We live and breathe marketing, staying ahead of trends and delivering tangible results. • Real people who bring fun into the room: We believe that the best work happens in an environment of collaboration, creativity, and enjoyment. • "What you see is what you get": No false upselling, no pretentious jargon, no hidden fees. We're transparent and direct. • Whacky minds that look at things differently: We thrive on innovative solutions and aren't afraid to challenge the status quo to find the best path for your brand. We want your trust, and we strive to become an extension to you and your business. Strong, honest relationships are key to enduring success, especially in challenging times. So, with nothing to lose and significant savings (and peace of mind) to gain, why not connect with Interlace today? transcript: SPR_COMBO[es]ChatGPT y Gemini fueron incorporadas de forma rápida en la rutina personal y profesional de millones de personas, pero la IA va más allá de dar respuestas a preguntas, su impacto permite mejorar el rendimiento de cualquier empresa A finales de los 80, la invención de la World Wide Web por Tim Berners-Lee marcó el inicio de una era que transformó la vida y el trabajo a nivel mundial. Más de tres décadas después, el impacto de los agentes de inteligencia artificial (IA) se perfila como un fenómeno de alcance comparable. Según especialistas de Globant, la irrupción de estos sistemas inteligentes genera un cambio profundo en las costumbres, tanto en personas como en empresas, y anticipa una nueva etapa, tan disruptiva como lo fue la llegada masiva de internet en los años noventa. Herramientas como ChatGPT y Gemini aparecieron en la vida diaria en un plazo sorprendentemente breve. Su expansión ilustra la rapidez con que los avances tecnológicos redefinen hábitos y expectativas sociales. Estos agentes, lejos de limitarse a ofrecer información, habilitan nuevas formas de interacción: analizan datos, generaran contenido y ajustan sus respuestas según las necesidades del usuario. Patricia Pomies, Global Chief Operating Officer en Globant, señala: “El cambio es incesante y nada indica que se detendrá”. De qué manera están cambiando los agentes de IA la vida cotidiana Al igual que tener un sitio web era sinónimo de modernidad hace 30 años, integrar agentes de IA se convierte hoy en un nuevo estándar para muchas empresas y usuarios. En menos de un año, asistentes virtuales empezaron a gestionar agendas, redactar documentos, responder consultas y ofrecer soluciones altamente personalizadas. Este auge responde, en parte, a la demanda de usuarios cada vez más exigentes que valoran la velocidad y la capacidad de producción. Según la consultora Gartner, los agentes de IA ya representan al menos el 15% de las decisiones laborales en diversos sectores. A diferencia de los sistemas tradicionales, no solo contestan preguntas, sino que aprenden e interpretan comportamientos, incorporan información y optimizan sus resultados. Pomies remarca: “El cambio exponencial es que no se limitan a responder, sino que analizan, ajustan, mejoran con el tiempo y ofrecen respuestas personalizadas. Definitivamente, el nuevo avance será una reconfiguración absoluta”. Qué sectores económicos lideran la adopción de agentes de inteligencia artificial Los sectores que mejor adaptan estas soluciones van desde el comercio minorista y los servicios financieros hasta la industria del entretenimiento. Según Pomies, los agentes de IA se consolidan como “socios estratégicos” integrados en los circuitos fundamentales de la economía digital. En la experiencia de compra, Burberry incorporó espejos interactivos y herramientas de realidad aumentada en sus tiendas. Estas tecnologías permiten a los clientes probar prendas virtualmente y recibir sugerencias instantáneas de artículos compatibles. Empresas como Ray-Ban y Amazon experimentan con desarrollos basados en IA para optimizar la toma de decisiones del consumidor. Con gafas inteligentes ya es posible comparar precios en tiempo real en diferentes marketplaces, mientras que los algoritmos de Amazon anticipan las preferencias de los compradores y sugieren productos ajustados a cada perfil. Cómo impacta en la eficiencia y la producción los agentes de IA El crecimiento de los agentes de IA transformó los procesos internos de compañías de todo el mundo. Un banco líder automatizó la conversación de su servicio de programación y redujo en 80% su tiempo de modernización. Una tarea que tradicionalmente demandaba 560 horas se completó en apenas 105. Esta mejora ilustra el potencial de la IA para multiplicar la productividad y agilizar la gestión de recursos. Sin embargo, adoptar esta tecnología implica desafíos. Tras la pandemia de COVID-19, el 85% de las industrias intentaron implementar soluciones digitales, aunque el 75% no obtuvo los resultados esperados por falta de madurez digital, según la consultora Boston Consulting Group. La actualización permanente de los sistemas y la capacitación continua aparecen como condiciones necesarias para aprovechar el potencial de los agentes inteligentes. Cuáles son los riesgos y obstáculos que acompañan este avance El ritmo acelerado de la adopción tecnológica exige a las empresas y a la sociedad anticiparse a los cambios, aunque las barreras no son menores. La curva de aprendizaje, la escasez de talento experimentado en IA y la necesidad de establecer marcos normativos y éticos adecuados presentan desafíos urgentes. Además, la transformación digital sigue incompleta en muchos sectores, lo que dificulta que las innovaciones tecnológicas se traduzcan en beneficios reales y sostenidos. Pomies subraya: “Durante tantos años se ha hablado de transformación digital, pero todavía el nuevo escenario con los agentes de IA está asomando. Aún parece lejos, pero si algo hemos visto en la evolución de internet desde Tim Berners-Lee hasta la fecha, es que todo sucede muy rápido y anticiparse suele ser la clave del éxito”.

transcript: Have YOU got a story? Email tips@dailymail.com New mum Poppy Delevingne was seen for the first time since giving birth on Sunday as she headed to Wimbledon day seven with her father Charles. The model, 39, and her billionaire businessman partner Archie Keswick, 44, who went public with their relationship last June, shared the happy news to Instagram on Friday that they had welcomed a baby girl back in May. And she looked happy and healthy as she arrived for the sporting event in a flared white jumpsuit which she wore with a beige jacket. She accessorised with dark shades and wore her blonde tresses in loose waves as she posed with her father who wore a dapper navy suit. Meanwhile Andrew Garfield, 41, and his rumoured girlfriend Monica Barbaro arrived hand in hand to the All England Tennis and Croquet Club. The American actress, 35, showed off her incredible figure in a strappy white top as they appeared to confirm their romance - after first sparking relationship rumours in February this year. Andrew looked smart as he matched her in white and had a knitted jumper slung over his shoulders. It comes after last weekend the pair reportedly packed on the PDA at Glastonbury Festival. Poppy announced she had welcomed her first child with her partner Archie on Friday. She shared their happy news to Instagram. Uploading a black and white snap clutching her baby girl's hand, Poppy penned: '20.05.25 The stars aligned, & then there was you.' Revealing her daughter's name, she continued: 'KAIA MOON KESWICK. Welcome to the world, baby bear. You have our hearts, our everything.' Poppy announced in January that she was expecting her first child, a baby girl, with her partner, Archie. The socialite said becoming a mother is 'all I've ever wanted,' as she shared the happy news with Elle magazine. Poppy first discovered she was pregnant during London Fashion Week when, during a fitting for a Burberry show, she noticed her clothes were tighter than usual. Sensing something was different, Poppy took a pregnancy test shortly after and then learned she was expecting a daughter. Speaking to ELLE UK in January, she said: 'Obviously, I would have been fine with either, and when I was younger, I always thought when I get pregnant, I wouldn't find out, but the second we got told we could find out, we did. I'm so excited. I come from all girls, we're very girl-heavy. Girls are great.' Poppy's sisters, model Cara, 32, and socialite Chloe, 39, were both delighted when she told them the news. She said: 'We were all in New York, with each other and with the bump, and there was a lot of talking to the bump, stroking the bump. They're just elated.' Poppy and Archie kept the news of her pregnancy to themselves for a while and only told friends and family around the four-month mark. The model previously admitted she was 'really nervous' about her pregnancy and wanted to 'protect' it for a while. She explained: 'It just feels like such an extraordinary privilege to be able to do this, to be able to have a baby at this age and at this time, and when it happened, I couldn't really believe it.' Poppy has long wanted to start a family of her own, but admitted in recent years she thought it might not happen for her and had 'made peace with it'. Poppy and Archie went public with their romance in July 2024, when they attended the BST Hyde Park festival together. Archie is the son of Simon Keswick, former director of multi-billion pound Hong Kong conglomerate Jardine Matheson - owner of the Mandarin Oriental Hotel Group. The family has a private fortune of £6.35bn, according to the Sunday Times Rich List, and owns an 18,000-acre estate in Angus. Now the group's interests range from prime Hong Kong real estate and brands, including the Mandarin Oriental Hotel, to Vietnam's largest dairy producer. Archie was previously described as a 'demon on the tennis court' who 'loves house music' by Tatler. The Eton-educated businessman was named as one of the world's most eligible bachelors back in 2019. Archie is no stranger to a high-profile relationship. He previously dated actress Sienna Miller, 43, who once lived with Poppy during their New York days. He was linked to Sienna after reportedly being friends for years. The actress is now in a relationship with model Oli Green, 28, and they welcomed a daughter in December 2023. Poppy was previously married to James Cook. While neither addressed the break-up publicly, they are said to have called time on their union after eight years in 2022. Before finding love with Archie, Poppy was linked to Prince Constantine Alexios of Greece, 26, in April 2023.

transcript:
SPR_COMBO[zh]🧩 设计背景
Mulberry 是1971年创立于英国萨默塞特郡的高级皮具品牌，以精湛工艺和质感皮革著称。 而 Bayswater Bag，诞生于2003年，由品牌首席设计师 Nicholas Knightly 设计，是 Mulberry 最具代表性的经典款式之一。 Bayswater 名字取自伦敦西部的一个地名，象征着低调的英伦优雅与实用主义精神。 这款包一经推出便迅速成为英国家喻户晓的“国民包袋”，也是凯特王妃、Alexa Chung 等英伦女性的常年爱用款。 ✨ 设计与特色
结构对称：Bayswater 外形方正、线条硬挺，轮廓稳定感极强，传递出一种沉静而专业的气质。 翻盖 + 扭锁设计：最具辨识度的细节是正中那颗金属椭圆形锁扣，既安全又具有 Mulberry DNA。 优质小牛皮：采用厚实纹理的天然皮革，表面处理保留皮革本身的肌理与光泽，兼具耐用与美观。 空间充裕：包内有隔层、拉链与贴袋，容量大而不臃肿，实用性极强，适合工作、通勤或日常出行。 可调节结构：两侧的包边可外翻或收紧，呈现出不同的包型风格。 👜 热门款式推荐
Bayswater Original：最经典的翻盖款，配有皮革内衬与金属锁扣，适合正式场合。 Bayswater Tote：去除翻盖，改为开放式大托特设计，更加轻便，适合日常购物或轻商务用途。 Mini Bayswater：缩小尺寸后更显可爱，搭配肩带可手提、斜挎两用，适合年轻女性通勤或休闲搭配。 Soft Bayswater：包身材质更加柔软，配色多为低饱和度的大地色系，更适合随性穿搭风格。 🌍 文化象征与风格定位
英伦经典代表：Bayswater 就像 Burberry 风衣一样，是英国女性衣橱里的“必备单品”。 中产审美的象征：它不标榜潮流，却以其扎实的工艺与持久耐看赢得上班族、教师、公务员等理性消费者青睐。 可世代传承的实用设计：不像流行款易过时，Bayswater 的实用与耐久让它成为“越用越有味道”的包袋。 💰 价格参考（2025年）
Bayswater Original：约 ¥9,000 – ¥12,000
Bayswater Tote：约 ¥8,500 – ¥10,000
Mini Bayswater：约 ¥7,500 – ¥9,000
Soft Bayswater / 限定色 / 特殊皮款：约 ¥10,000 – ¥13,000+
👗 搭配建议
通勤场合：深棕或黑色 Bayswater 搭配西装裤或风衣，稳重、精致、毫不张扬。 复古学院风：与粗花呢大衣、复古长裙、乐福鞋搭配，塑造知性英伦女子形象。 休闲日常：选择淡粉、浅灰等柔和配色款式，搭配牛仔裤与羊绒针织，温柔而有质感。 年轻混搭：Mini Bayswater 搭配运动鞋与阔腿裤，在经典中加入现代节奏感。 #奢侈品#时尚 #手袋

transcript: SPR_COMBO[it]La nuova campagna di Burberry è un tributo alla musica e alle sue star e pure al tempo atmosferico britannico, con fango e pioggia parti integranti del festival di Glastonbury. Firmata dalla regista Kim Gehrig, è una passerella di trench e wellington con il Burberry check indossati, tra gli altri, da Liam Gallagher, Goldie e Alexa Chung. L'estetica è un omaggio agli anni '90, con filmati d'archivio alternati a riprese stilizzate per mostrare lo spirito del festival simbolo della 'Cool Britannia', con la colonna sonora di 'Sweet Harmony' dei Liquid. [embedded content] La tradizione del marchio, e il suo contributo alla definizione di quello che è diventato Glastonbury, è racchiusa nella passeggiata di Liam Gallagher che indossa un suo parka Burberry del 2018, il futuro è rappresentato dalla nuova generazione dei Gallagher: Lennon, Molly Moorish-Gallagher e Gene. “Burberry è al centro del calendario estivo, è sia un mezzo di espressione creativa che un'uniforme imprescindibile per i frequentatori di festival”, ha affermato Daniel Lee, direttore creativo del marchio. Creative Direction: Daniel Lee Artistic Direction: Lane & Associates Director: Kim Gehrig Photographer: Drew Vickers 2

transcript: SPR_COMBO[de]Eines der größten Schönheitsunternehmen der Welt ist Berichten zufolge einen Verkauf von sich selbst. Anfang Juni berichtete WWD, dass Coty erwägt, seine Verbraucher- und Prestige-Divisionen zu veräußern, darunter einige der bekanntesten Marken von Beauty wie Covergirl sowie Chloé- und Hugo-Chef-Parfums. Die Ankündigung versetzte den Aktienkurs von Coty 13 Prozent auf 5 USD; Die Veräußerung beider Waffen würde im Wesentlichen mehr als 120 Jahre als Unternehmen beendet. Coty lehnte es ab, sich zu dem Bericht zu äußern. Trotz seiner Größe und Stall bekannter Namen hat das amerikanische Konglomerat in den letzten Jahren Schwierigkeiten, mit seinen Konkurrenten Schritt zu halten. Innerhalb des Portfolios seines größten Anteilseigners Jab Holdings ist Coty das schlechteste Kapital und senkt den Ausblick im letzten Geschäftsjahr, wobei weitere Umsatzrückgänge projiziert werden. Coty hat versucht, sein Ansehen zu verbessern. Seit seinem derzeitigen CEO Sue Nabi im Jahr 2020 eintraf, hat das Unternehmen das Fett getrimmt und nicht-Kernmarken wie Professional Lines Wella und OPI abgebrochen. Aber es bleibt immer noch seine äußeren Kollegen wie L'Oréal und Elf Beauty zurück, und im Mai verkaufte es Skkn von Kim, der Prestige-Hautpflegemarke, an seinen Gründer zurück, den Multi-Hyphenate-Reality-Star Kim Kardashian und ihre Bekleidungsfirma Skims, nachdem die Marke versäumt hatte, mit Schaufenster für Furore zu machen. Die Kerngeschäfte, Duft- und Drogerie -Make -up, stehen ebenfalls unter Druck. Während der Duft die kategorische Kategorie der Branche ist und Coty einige der weltweit bekanntesten Düfte der Welt herstellt, ist der heftig wettbewerbsfähige Sektor mit neuen Herausforderern gefüllt. Die Bemühungen, das Summen wie trendige Körpermists für Calvin Klein und die Wiederbelebung von Marc Jacobs Beauty zu fördern, sind in einem von Nischenspieler und Tiktok -Viralität dominierten Markt ein Rückgang des Ozeans. Die Drogerie -Marken haben ebenfalls unterdurchschnittlich geschafft. “So ziemlich alles in der Messe hat nicht funktioniert … Ich gebe ihnen viel Anerkennung dafür, dass sie kreativ sind und Dinge ausprobieren”, sagte Lauren Lieberman, Geschäftsführer bei Barclays Consumer Practice, in der Bemühungen zur Wiederbelebung von Covergirl. Sie bemerkte auch die gedämpfte Wiederbelebung der Philosophie, die Hautpflege und die Bade- und Körperlinie, die ein großer Erfolg in den Aughts sowie die Sun Care Line Lancaster war. Mit dem Rücktritt von Jab Holdings 'langjähriger Vorsitzender Peter Harb im April wird neue Führung wahrscheinlich für ein neues Denken bereit sein. Wenn Coty versucht, Käufer von Gerichts zu nehmen, sind potenzielle Bieter schlank und würden wahrscheinlich in einige ausgewählte Kategorien fallen. bricht zusammen, wer interessiert sein könnte – und warum – unten. Die Kronjuwelen Prestige -Duft bleibt Cotys heißeste Eigenschaft. Es enthält langfristige Lizenzen für Chloé, Gucci, Hugo-Chef und Calvin Klein, einige der berühmtesten Modehäuser der Welt. Hugo -Chef wird als die größte Marke des Unternehmens angesehen, die rund 10 Prozent oder rund 585 Millionen US -Dollar in Höhe von rund 9 Prozent und 7 Prozent des Gesamtumsatzes des Unternehmens umfasst. Dies sind wünschenswerte Vermögenswerte, selbst mit intensiver Konkurrenz durch Inseln auf dem Weg. Diese Düfte des Modehaus sind weit verbreitet, bekannt und haben ein integriertes Prestige und Dynamik. Ein Spezialist für Duftlizenzspezialist wie Interphlum, das für Lacoste und Anna Sui Parfums herstellt, könnte theoretisch interessiert sein. Seit 2022 hat es DKNY wiederbelebt und die Linie neu anspricht, nachdem LVMH sie an die G-III-Gruppe, ein Modeportfoliounternehmen, abgeladen hatte. Das spanische Konglomerat Puig könnte auch ein Anwärter sein; Während es sein Vertrauen in die Lizenzierung verringert hat und sich stattdessen auf den Besitz von Marken verändert hat, nachdem sie Byredo und Charlotte Tilbury aufgenommen haben, verwaltet es geschickt ähnliche Modehaus-Duftmarken wie Carolina Herrera und Jean-Paul Gaultier und könnte dazu beitragen, dass die Marken frische Energie injizieren könnten. Mode -Lizenzunternehmen wie Tapestry, PVH Corp oder Capri könnten auch daran interessiert sein, ihre Bestände zu diversifizieren und dem Mix Schönheit zu verleihen, insbesondere für bewährte Linien wie Burberry und Calvin Klein, von denen letztere das Modegeschäft besitzt. Der Luxusmarken ' Mutterunternehmen möchten möglicherweise auch ihre Schönheitsangebote wieder in Haus bringen. Der Gucci-Besitzer Kering hat kein Geheimnis aus seinen lauwartigen Gefühlen gegenüber der Gucci-Schönheitsmarke unter Cotys Besitz, die 2028 abläuft, kein Geheimnis gemacht, und Kering hat jetzt eine interne Schönheitsabteilung mit Creed. LVMH, dem Marc Jacobs gehört, hat sich als Expertise in Beauty bewährt und Schönheitsangebote wie Dior und Guerlain verwaltet. „Die Tatsache, dass Coty gedauert hat [as a company] So lange ist, weil Duft ein so großartiges Geschäft ist “, sagte Lieberman. In jüngerer Zeit beginnen Unternehmen wie LVMH und KERING ihre eigenen Schönheitswaffen oder konsolidieren ihre Bemühungen auf andere Weise. Lieberman sagte, andere Firmen wie Puig oder Fashion Lizenzierhäuser könnten alle logische Bieter sein, aber das Reiben ist, dass Cotys Fähigkeit, diese Lizenzen zu verkaufen, nicht eindeutig ist. Abhängig von der Art der unterzeichneten ursprünglichen Vereinbarungen können sie möglicherweise das Eigentum an ein neues Unternehmen übertragen. Massenbeschwerde Cotys Sortiment an Massenmarken wie Rimmel und Covergirl hat eine Namenserkennung, aber das Wachstum hat stagniert, da sie Marktanteile an schneller bewegende Indies wie Elf Beauty und Kiko Milano abgeschlossen haben. Sally Hansen ist laut Nielsen-IQ-Daten die größte Massennagelmarke der USA mit einem Marktanteil von 38 Prozent, obwohl der Umsatz auch gesunken ist, da die Verbraucher länger anhaltende Behandlungen priorisieren. Während die Massenmarken von Coty oft unter den Top 10 rangieren, ist der Drogeriekanal in den USA insgesamt weniger lukrativ geworden, da die Auswahl der Marken und im Geschäftserfahrung nicht mit Amazon und zunehmend Tiktok-Shop konkurrieren. Es ist unwahrscheinlich, dass ein strategischer Käufer eine so durchdrungene Marke mit niedrigem Wachstumskaderraum übernehmen möchte, aber Private Equity könnte für die Herausforderung stehen, insbesondere wenn er internationale Möglichkeiten für die Marken sieht. Solche Carve-Outs sind nicht ungewöhnlich in der Schönheit, sondern konzentrieren sich häufig auf Prestige-Marken: Private Equity Firm Advent Creecting im Jahr 2022, um Bareminerals, Buxom und Laura Mercier von Shiseido zu kaufen, während Coty einige seiner professionellen Marken, einschließlich Wella Company, im Jahr 2020 zum Private Equity-Unternehmen KKR abfuhr. Coty besitzt auch einige in Brasilien ansässige Körperpflege -Linien wie Bozzano, Monange, Paixao und Risiken, was für einen inländischen Spieler wie den früheren Aesop und Avon -Besitzer Natura mit seinem Heimatvorteil von Interesse sein könnte. Unabhängig davon, welcher Weg es weitergibt, ist eine Neukalibrierung wahrscheinlich bei Coty erforderlich. Und Käufer achten Sie auf-selbst die bekanntesten Marken von Beauty kämpfen darum, ein sinnvolles Wachstum in einer so wettbewerbsfähigen Landschaft zu erzielen. “[Coty's] Marken sollten relevant sein, aber es ist draußen überfüllt “, sagte Lieberman. transcript: Get our award-winning daily news email featuring exclusive stories, opinion and expert analysis I would like to be emailed about offers, event and updates from Evening Standard. Read our privacy notice. First there was “Gareth Southgate” Tube station. Then Bond Street station was renamed “Burberry Street” and Old Street became “Fold Street”. Now Transport for London is looking to generate millions with a major gear change in how it cashes in on the Tube's world-famous brand – by offering businesses the chance to sponsor an entire line. TfL has begun promoting the opportunity to become the “first-ever sponsor of the Waterloo & City line”, the two-stop, three-minute shuttle service that links Waterloo and Bank stations. It has placed an advert on its LinkedIn page offering an “exclusive” deal that “goes far beyond a typical media opportunity”. TfL said: “It's full-line branding, from moquette seat fabric and signage to maps and experiential spaces, all right in the heart of London's business district. “Millions of professionals and decision-makers travel this route every year. Now, your brand can own the journey.” Nicknamed “The Drain” and traditionally used by commuters heading into the Square Mile after arriving by train at Waterloo, the Waterloo & City is the shortest of the 11 lines on the London Underground and is only open on weekdays. Southgate station, at the northern end of the Piccadilly line, was temporarily renamed “Gareth Southgate” Tube station by Visa in honour of the then England manager after the national team reached the semi-final of the 2018 World Cup. The two-day “takeover” of Southgate station generated £80,000 for TfL and included branded roundels, themed Tannoy announcements, digital screen messages and flash mobs. Bond Street was briefly renamed “Burberry Street” by the fashion brand to mark London Fashion Week in October 2023. However this led to 57 complaints to TfL, relating mainly to concerns about passengers becoming confused by the mock Tube signs. Last year, Old Street became “Fold Street” to promote Samsung's “Fold and Flip” smartphones, generating £250,000 for TfL. At the time, Transport For All, which represents passengers with disabilities, raised concerns about the Tube becoming a “wild-west PR playground”. One of the most lucrative Tube branding deals was the £830,000 TfL received from Galaxy when it allowed the Circle line to feature in a “reimagined” version of Harry Beck's classic Tube map in January 2024. But the five-year IFS Cloud sponsorship of the cable car – which crosses the Thames between the Royal Docks and North Greenwich – may be the best baseline indicator of the kind of deal TfL will be hoping to secure in return for allowing a firm to add its name as a prefix to the Waterloo & City line. The cable car sponsorship is worth £2.1m – but the Waterloo & City line boasts tens of thousands of commuters each day as a “ captive audience” - rather than day-trippers and foreign tourists. The Waterloo & City line first opened in 1898 and was only the second electric line on the Underground. Passenger access to the platforms at Bank station – originally known as City - was by a lengthy sloping subway, which is believed to have led to the nickname The Drain. The walkway was upgraded to have moving walkways in 1960. The 48-hour rebranding of the Circle line was done by Samsung to promote its S24 Ultra phone. There were advertising displays at Victoria, Blackfriars, Liverpool Street, Paddington and Westminster stations and “a complete domination of Kings Cross St Pancras”. TfL said the campaign was “hugely popular, receiving rave reviews and has been nominated for numerous awards”. Amazon Prime paid TfL £250,000 in 2020 to rebrand Piccadilly Circus station as Picardilly Circus for 48 hours to promote the Star Trek spin-off series, Picard. The station name was changed to Picardilly on all line maps and platform roundels to create an “immersive experience” for passengers. There were also themed Tannoy announcements in the voice of Captain Jean Luc Picard and an advertising domination throughout the station. The promotion was widely covered by the news media and even featured on The Graham Norton Show. It also won the 'Most Spectacular' award at the Drum Out of Home Awards. In 2020, Sony replaced the roundels outside Oxford Circus station with PlayStation symbols for 48 hours to promote the launch of the PS5. Inside the station, PlayStation symbols featured on line maps and special vinyls across all six platforms. At four other stations, large-scale graphics were installed featuring the name of the station changed to reference a PS5 game, such as Ratchet and Clankaster Gate and Miles End.

transcript: With Glastonbury avoiding a total wash-out and Oasis giving the nation some serious 90s nostalgia, the timing couldn't be better for Kim Gehrig's striking new Festival film for Burberry to emerge from the mosh pit. Collating images both contemporary and archival, the Somesuch director's spot leans heavily into the 'mad for it' vibes of letting your hair down in a field, replete with Liquid's rave-era classic Sweet Harmony pumping in the background. Featuring Liam Gallagher, Alexa Chung, Goldie, Loyle Carner, and more, this blast from the past cements the brand's place as part of the fabric of the UK.

transcript: Transport for London (TfL) is selling the rights to an entire line in a bid to raise millions. In a post on the social media platform LinkedIn, announced it was offering “exclusive sponsorship” of the Waterloo and City line, which connects and Waterloo stations. The two-stop, three-minute shuttle service, which is only open on weekdays, is London's least-used line, but still ferries around 15 million people each year. TfL said the opportunity to sponsor the line would not involve renaming it but would “go far beyond a typical media opportunity”. They said the sponsorship would include “full-line branding, from moquette seat fabric and signage to maps and experiential spaces”. “Millions of professionals and decision-makers travel this route every year,” the advert read. “Now, your brand can own the journey.” While this would be the first time an entire Tube line has been offered for sponsorship, several stations have been sponsored. Southgate station was temporarily renamed “” Tube station by Visa in honour of the then-England manager after the national team made the semi-final of the 2018 World Cup. The two-day takeover of the final stop on the Piccadilly line generated £80,000 for TfL. The sponsorship included branded roundels, themed Tannoy announcements, digital screen messages and flash mobs. A few years later, during London Fashion Week in October 2023, Bond Street was briefly renamed “Burberry Street”. The name change led to 57 complaints to TfL as passengers complained about becoming confused by the mock Tube signs. Complaints were also made last year when Samsung renamed Old Street to “Fold Street” to promote their new “Fold and Flip” smartphone, generating £250,000 for TfL. The only time that a public transport line in London has been completely sponsored is the £2.1 million five-year IFS Cloud sponsorship of the cable car, which crosses the Thames between the Royal Docks and North Greenwich. The Waterloo and City line, however, boasts 10 times the number of annual users.

transcript: Whether we like it or not, Britpop fashion is back. Think scruffy street style with a brash British designer flair. Kangol bucket hats pulled down over bushy eyebrows and broody-moody eyes. Tight fitting Fred Perry polo shirts or Manchester City football jersey stuck into baggy jeans with a Fred Perry Harrington parka jacket and a can of cider is the mandatory style uniform of the '90s “Brat Pack”. Pic: AFP STRINGER/AFP via And with Oasis fever kicking off with the notoriously notorious rabble-rousing bands' reunion tour underway, football hooliganism fashion is poised to be the sartorial trend this summer. Liam Gallagher with his mother Peggy in 1995. Pic: Dave Hogan/ So ahead of the Oasis gigs in Croke Park in August the shops are already stuffed with Noel and Liam Gallagher fashion -inspired gear for men and women. So before you rock out to the  90's band  let's take a look back to fashion decades past and check out what's in store for style conscious boys and girls heading to see Oasis and Blur over the next few months. Noel and Liam Gallagher of Oasis. Pic: Dave Hogan/ JD Sports have a “deadly' range of Fred Perry polo shirts that are ripped straight from the brothers Gallagher 1995 Wonderwall wardrobe. The sports store carries a throwback line of Fred Perry polos in a multitude of colours that are unisex so what's good for the boys also looks great on girls. Liam Gallagher with Blur's Damon Albarn. Pic: Avalon/ And don't blur the sartorial lines when it comes to 90's Parka jackets. The slouchy oversized hooded shell Harrington jacket made famous by Bur frontman Matt Albarn , has made an almighty comeback. In Fact so popular is the Harrington jacket that  fashion  brand  Fred Perry has reissued a replica of Albarn 's iconic oversized beige parka ahead of the bands comeback tour. And footballs coming home, it's coming home. Is football ever away is more the question. Liam and Noel Gallagher of Oasis. Pic: James Mccauley/REX/Shutterstock JD Sports stores are jam packed with football kits for fans of every team from every single league across the country. But for the die hard Brit Pop fans a bona fide Manchester  City Brother sponsored jersey is the  coveted clobber for concert goers. An array of online vintage stores and Amazon are flogging 90's era Man City jerseys just for the Oasis reunion occasion. Liam Gallagher of Oasis at the Glastonbury Festival in 1995. Pic: Lindsay Magos/REX/Shutterstock In the footwear department  the shoes of the season have  to be scruffy three striped Adidas trainers that are suitable mucky to match the unkempt Oasis look. And for the more flush of cash Burberry and Vivienne Westwood are the only British designer brands to be seen dead or alive in this summer for dedicated followers of Brit Pop fashion.
